intro: Yinshania fumarioides, commonly known as the fumarioid flame vine, is a climbing perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red to orange flowers that resemble those of the genus Fumaria, giving it its common name. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, pointed leaflets and produces long, twisting tendrils that help it climb supports. Its flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom throughout the growing season. Yinshania fumarioides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
